t: God*pn presides in the great assembly; he*ld renders judgment among the “gods”:
“How*pn long will you defend the unjust and*ld show partiality to the wicked?
Defend*ln the weak and the fatherless; uphold*ld the cause of the poor and the oppressed.
Rescue*ln the weak and the needy; deliver*ld them from the hand of the wicked.
“The*pn ‘gods’ know nothing, they understand nothing. They*ld walk about in darkness; all*ld the foundations of the earth are shaken.
“I*pn said, ‘You are “gods”; you*ld are all sons of the Most High.’
But*ln you will die like mere mortals; you*ld will fall like every other ruler.”
Rise*pn up, O God, judge the earth, for*ld all the nations are your inheritance.
